body:
Dear LB-HB Community,

Currently I am working on a base case model for my study. I am confused about a situation here. The model that I am working on is a South oriented, 5X5X3m office room with some assumptions that you can see at the attached image. For now, the space is not conditioned. I doubt about the interior temperature. Is there something wrong about my definition? Or is it normal because of the excessive glazing. I will further study the influence of shading geometry on thermal and visual comfort.

Your comments are more than welcome.

Best regards,
Mustafa [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JomcnL50vYDmWspCYBpnPa1kyNmALLayiDmWkqsBiKPBBgGO7JF5*bop0B33T3q1RVFiYkIYAbB9KY63TBGhHBWAI8QbOQjr/Analysis_0.jpg)
topic: Inside temperature of a box model

replies.body: This is even more confusing for me because solar screen that I added, didn't make a considerable change in the inside temperature. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JomcnL50vYDUyQ35U9wiomW0XNU0fpA8PFf-*xI*O*TmTDiKoFJCDycoN6TSZMTkrcs6RwC*68bIHEX0T-8RWPSAwwg-sGFl/Analysis_3.jpg)

Mustafa, Glazing is not added to your room correctly. I tested with the new release and it does work correctly. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JomcnL50vYD8BA6b4VArGRj0QNEVb3htRzxH7Hme-IQujGtyezvfarx*9GScRWSYBQufAN*MAPOOZkcYJEkfrNePYvlaJjtF/addGlz.png)

Mostapha, Yes, it works correctly in the new release. The results seem coherent. Thank you very much.  [
](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JomcnL50vYDnTbtuqiTfKQ3Ci0rigsAC40stLo*26SKzmX00zm34T9wDwrdgGsaRxcDiCmjjToJdAcDNhP23DWLCdn4SeWMk/Analysis_4.jpg) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JomcnL50vYDOhI4urn8FLzeQiKFXROcEsH*Sgv0JGUFiJxBOihL074j5NpB6nUgUuu9z9hsJg3KQ-TlvzLL-SfDIoM6-TaeY/Analysis_5.jpg) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JomcnL50vYAFokqDLm87rOBpBYbIqBXQvQqBpvkBLLHGQuQ026YYKwQ2jE-bvsX6hQo82ykj1Z2SsgfEI-J2pBJSIg5M*A13/Analysis_6.jpg)
